Posts.Content: You should have cake. And balloons and party favors. Hooray for you!!! Be Well, Dianne
I can't say for sure but sounds like a miscommunication to me! Dianne
Posts.Title: on call doctor out of line or not? your take ladies!

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry, Debbie about your news. Just remember; Third time's a charm! I am sending you happy wishes and loving prayers for your easy recovery. Be Well, Dianne
Posts.Title: Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry, Debbie about your news. Just remember; Third time's a charm! I am sending you happy wishes and loving prayers for your easy recovery. Be Well, Dianne
Posts.Title: Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: Good for you for donating your hair! And welcome! I am a newbie myself here. It is a wonderful place to be. I hope your tx goes smoothly. I will say a prayer for you "May you be at Peace; May you be free of Suffering." Dianne
Posts.Title: They say they got it all But..........

Posts.Content: Yes, I have had blurry vision since starting Chemo back in Oct. My daughter is an Opthalmic Tech. and she says it is from the chemo. Dianne
Posts.Title: Taxol or perhaps A/C changed my eyesight!

Posts.Content: So happy to hear that you are port-less! I am sorry you had to experience pain, though. I can't wait to get mine out! I want it out of me in the worst way. But I have to wait, so congratulations on your graduation! Be Well, Dianne
Posts.Title: I have been deported!

Posts.Content: You've got to fight the Beast for all it's worth! Whatever it takes, you ultimately make the final decisions. Hang in there. Sounds like you are on the right track. Be Well, Dianne
Posts.Title: I have decided to give this everything I've got!

Posts.Content: It makes my heart glad to hear your good news! Score one for the good guys! Be well, Dianne
Posts.Title: No Colon Cancer,Thank you Jesus

Posts.Content: My chemo yesterday went off without a hitch!! I can't believe it, I'm finally done! I wanted to thank all of you wonderful ladies for the support and comraderie. Sorry, I'm having a chemobrain day. Everything I write or type comes out wrong. You know what I mean, don't you? I go today for my LAST NEULASTA shot!! Whoppeee! No more bone pain!THey have me coming in this Thurs and next Monday for Hydration, then I go back to see my Onc on the 4th of April and to have my port flushed. She said she wanted it to stay in for another 6 months! Yuck! I hate it! But she said you never know and I might need Fluids at some point. I meet my RadOnc Dr. on the 25th for a planning session. On to the next phase of cancerworld. Thanks for everything, Dianne
Posts.Title: Thanks to all my Pink Warriors

Posts.Content: Thanks for sharing the article. It just goes to show that people who haven't themselves had cancer, really don't know what to say to someone who has. Dianne
Posts.Title: The Cheerleader, the Funny Guy & the Interrogator

Posts.Content: Hi Taleena I am now saying a prayer for you and holding you in my thoughts. I hope everything will be alright. Hang in there. Dianne
Posts.Title: Please just say a little prayer....

Posts.Content: Hi Taleena I am now saying a prayer for you and holding you in my thoughts. I hope everything will be alright. Hang in there. Dianne
Posts.Title: Please just say a little prayer....

Posts.Content: Sounds like you had an awesome time! The walking is actually good for you, although maybe not for quite as long. I would be siiked to see King Tut's Mummy, and his Daddy for that matter, lol! I really enjoy reading your posts. I feel you are a very strong woman, much like myself. Glad to hear you got out and about. Be Well, Dianne
Posts.Title: Back from vacation :)

Posts.Content: Nice Job! Congratulations on making it through the torture chamber! Well done! Dianne
Posts.Title: I am a rad grad! Yipee!!

Posts.Content: You are going through so much right now that you need to give yourself a break! I sometimes play the "what ifs" and it drives me insane! What if this and what if that...it's crazy-making! Time to slow down and take it one step at a time, one day at a time, one moment at a time! You are a survivor. You must remember that. Whatever life throws at you, you will handle in its own time. Ice your cake, but you don't have to "put on a happy face," cancer sucks and it's okay to show your feelings. You will be in my thoughts and prayers. "May you be at Peace, May you be Free of Suffering," Dianne
Posts.Title: Freaking Out

Posts.Content: You were such a good friend to her and I'm sure that made all the difference in the world. She fought valiantly and you were there with her every step of the way. Now the time has come for her to go home. I am so very sorry for your loss. I will be praying for the lot of you, rest assured. "May she be at Peace; May she be free of Suffering," Dianne
Posts.Title: With a heavy heart..
